While the university is on break until January 2, take a moment and explore the top Yale News stories of 2019.
Produced by the School of Forestry & Environmental Studies, Yale e360 is an online magazine offering opinion, analysis, reporting, and debate on global environmental issues.
New image offers close-up view of interstellar comet
A comet named 2I/Borisov is expected to reach its closest point to Earth this week. This is only the second interstellar object to be seen in our solar system.
A stunning new image of 2l/Borisov with a photo of Earth to show scale.
Yale SOM receives largest gift in its history from The Broad Foundation
Funded by a $100 million gift, the Broad Center at the School of Management will develop initiatives devoted to strengthening leadership in America’s public schools.
Produced by the School of Management, Yale Insights poses questions that examine issues at the intersection of business and society.
Interested in whipping up a more traditional meal this year? Look no further than 1785’s “New British Jewel” cookbook, held in the Beinecke Library’s archives.

, another extraordinary season is under way at the Yale Rep.

Robert Shiller on the power of narratives
The Nobel Prize-winning economist and Sterling Professor of Economics discusses how stories can influence booms, recessions, and other economic events.
Community invited to Veterans Day ceremony
Yale will salute the men and women who have served our country at a Veterans Day ceremony on Monday, Nov. 11 at 12:30 p.m. in Battell Chapel. All are welcome.
An inspiration to all who enter

From ancient papyri and medieval manuscripts to the archived personal papers of modern writers, the Beinecke holds one of the largest and most dynamic collections of rare books and manuscripts in the world.

This week, Yale celebrates the grand opening of the Yale Science Building, which offers faculty and students seven stories and 280,300 square feet of newly finished space in which to answer some of the most important scientific questions of the 21st century.
Haas Library exhibit marks 150th anniversary of Yale School of Art
The Yale School of Art, the first art school based on a university campus in the United States and the first school at Yale to accept women students, marks its 150th anniversary this year.

Celebrating its five-year anniversary, the Yale Quantum Institute facilitates the research and teaching of quantum science on campus. Since October 2014, the institute has grown to host 60 public events, has 23 faculty members on its board, and spans across six departments at Yale.
New scholarships ensure affordability at Yale
Yale has announced an expansion of financial aid policies to cover the full cost of all billed expenses for students from families with incomes below $75,000.
Student life at Yale College is steeped in many special traditions developed over the centuries.
